doc:
Monroe Salisbury https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monroe_Salisbury 0 Monroe Salisbury (May 8, 1876 – August 7, 1935) was an American actor. He appeared on the stage for several years and then became an early film star. Salisbury was a matinee idol. He began his acting career on the stage in 1898, appearing in numerous romantic leads. He also appeared in five Broadway productions. He was in 42 silent movies between 1914 and 1922, working frequently with director Cecil B. DeMille. Salisbury, who appeared in several western films, also appeared in two talkies, in 1929 and 1930. After his career was at an end, Salisbury died at a mental hospital from a fractured skull sustained during a fall. Monroe_Salisbury ( May_8_,_1876 – August_7_,_1935 ) was an_American_actor . He appeared on the_stage for several_years and then became an_early_film_star . Salisbury was a_matinee_idol . He began his_acting_career on the_stage in 1898 , appearing in numerous_romantic_leads . He also appeared in five_Broadway_productions . He was in 42_silent_movies between 1914_and_1922 , working frequently with director_Cecil_B._DeMille . Salisbury , who appeared in several_western_films , also appeared in two_talkies , in 1929_and_1930 . After his_career was at an_end , Salisbury died at a_mental_hospital from a_fractured_skull sustained during a_fall .
